title: Permaban for this???
body:
So, I was playing a few games lately and some of them didn't go too well. I was arguing with a few players on my team and that apparently got me permabanned, as I was reported and punished already before. I don't really understand the politics behind the punishment on lol, though. It appears to me that you can play as shitty as you want, even intentionally and as soon as someone points that out, you can report him and he gets banned.
I will show you the following example in which I probably could have just stopped arguing, but I do not understand why people play ranked if they do not want to win and just fuck around. I wouldn't mind that on normals, but I think ranked is supposed to be taken a bit more serious..

So I was toplaning as teemo vs Illaoi and the midlaner was fizz playing against bard. Fizz was constantly leaving mid to roam, but didnt actually get anything out of it, while bard used the opportunity to get kills and take the whole mid lane. Fizz came top a couple of times, which was not helping me a bit at that point, especially since he also came right after I recalled, took my cs and froze the lane and the opponents turrets. And as Bard's roams more or less destroyed our botlane I told fizz to stay mid. He refused to do so for the majority of the game (he always said ok, though), which eventually cost us the whole game as they essentially got  a free lane.
Here is the chatlog that got me reported (so you only see me talking):

Herr Hugendubel: wow illaoi must be blind
Herr Hugendubel: yeah welll.. fizz is also blind
Herr Hugendubel: it is lee sin commemoration week

Herr Hugendubel: stop getting my cs top
Herr Hugendubel: get mid
Herr Hugendubel: fizz u ar eawful
Herr Hugendubel: if u had done the minimum mid we would have had first blood turret
Herr Hugendubel: u might not get it but ur roaming kills us
Herr Hugendubel: go mid
Herr Hugendubel: i am good on top
Herr Hugendubel: fizz if u continue to leavemid i go afk
Herr Hugendubel: u lose the game
Herr Hugendubel: for all of us
Herr Hugendubel: it is not good , it shows that you have no clue
Herr Hugendubel: bard roams and gets turrets
Herr Hugendubel: u get noghting so far
Herr Hugendubel: he lost mid turret although i asked him to stay mid an dpush
Herr Hugendubel: and meanwhile bard is roaming all over the map
Herr Hugendubel: bc fizz makes no pressure
Herr Hugendubel: im done
Herr Hugendubel: he threw the game from the stary
Herr Hugendubel: stay mid and push ur alne
Herr Hugendubel: do NOT come
Herr Hugendubel: stay in ur alne
Herr Hugendubel: STAY MID
Herr Hugendubel: STAY MID
Herr Hugendubel: FIZZ STOP THROWING
Herr Hugendubel: great job
Herr Hugendubel: u could have not thrown mid the whoile time and listened
Herr Hugendubel: i won top and u all run top ha;f the time
Herr Hugendubel: bard killed everyone bc of the retarded fizz
Herr Hugendubel: who would always say ok, but never do what i asked
Herr Hugendubel: now mid is lost and they won the game
Herr Hugendubel: if u would listen we would
Herr Hugendubel: fizz go mid and stay there
Herr Hugendubel: u throw and threow
Herr Hugendubel: yeah you suck anyways, fizz
Herr Hugendubel: swear in vietnamese all u like

So, what is your take on this? I personally believe that punishing for saying stuff isnt reasonable at all, as you can always mute someone, while playing intentionally against the team is almost never banned, bc it is simply much harder to prove. But if someone gets angry, bc his teammate steals his cs, his buffs, etc and then says something, I think it shouldn't be the guy who said something to get punished, but rather the guy who intentionally set his teammate back. What do you think?

replies.body:
1. You handpicked a single chat log to show from your reform card. Multiple were given. This wasn't the most recent game given, or the most severe.

2. This is your 6th penalty. When you got your 14-day ban, you were told that the next penalty would result in a permanent ban.

You should really post all logs given, and present the question 'should this result in a chat restriction', because that is what is in question here. Presenting a single hand-picked log, without providing historical information about the state of your account and asking whether that 1 log should result in a perma-ban isn't really the analysis.
{{summoner:11}}
As 3 chatlogs are required for a ban, any one of them has to be sufficient. The other two are slightly worse, but not that bad either.
3 chat logs are not required for a ban. I'm not sure where you got that information/idea, but it is incorrect.

So, why do I get 3 chat logs displayed then?

I thought that these were the ones that caused the ban..

they are examples of unacceptable behavior. 

Your real report card probably looks like "you have been validly reported in 68 games of the past 90 games".

Okay, but this is actually the same then, cause this means that what I posted here is deemed unacceptable.

Btw, I find the downvoting in the thread here very funny, I bet I could write something like "I like pizza" and would get downvoted for it. Kind of shows a general attitude, but whatever.
How does upvoting / downvoting matter in your eyes, and why would it matter for your case?

Insults, belittling him, threatening to AFK, and accusations if throwing. Maybe he just wasn't a good Fizz: that's different than intentionally throwing.

> So, what is your take on this? I personally believe that punishing for saying stuff isnt reasonable at all, as you can always mute someone, while playing intentionally against the team is almost never banned, bc it is simply much harder to prove.

My take is that this doesn't sound intentional: it sounds like a Fizz who isn't good at roaming and didn't want you to boss him around. Further, the mute button is like a shield: it exists to help you protect against toxicity, but that's no excuse for attacking someone. So yes, the person being toxic with language should be punished, as, yes, should someone INTENTIONALLY throwing the game. It doesn't seem like Fizz necessarily was.

>I think it shouldn't be the guy who said something to get punished, but rather the guy who intentionally set his teammate back. What do you think?

Both should be. But, again, I haven't seen the game in question. From what you've said it just seems like a Fizz who doesn't know how to roam well.

I honestly think it's also because he only attacked fizz. Harassment tends to be measured by how much you harassed someone. Sometimes I slip up and tell a player they suck if they're not pinging mia or whatever, but I don't keep ragging on him all game.

This usually occurs early game when I'm focusing on last hitting, because for me last hitting is hard, so I tend to not look at my map. Later on when I can basically one shot minions, I ping for other people.

Because this obviously loses the game for us and I could as well afk and it is the very same result in the end.
'All I did was spend the entire game badgering mid'

This is all I said the whole game (i.e. in almost 40 minutes). You can hardly say it is "spending the entire game badgering". The point is that if someone plays obviously wrong, you should be able to point it out in a team game. If I address him maybe once in 10 minutes, it means I was hoping he would actually improve and then told him again cause he didn't. Again, this is ranked and if you choose to play ranked you should try to win the game. Otherwise play normals or against bots. 
I assume if I would run into your lane and take your cs, you would do or say nothing about it. If I then feed your lane opponent free kills you would do or say nothing about it... To me, this makes no sense. It is a team game and there are some general rules how the game works, one of which is not leave ur lane for 80% of the game and not even return to it when they are attacking ur inhib turret. If it is not okay to say something at this point, why don't they just disable the chat altogether. I pointed out to my teammate why we lose the game and that it is upon him to change this and if that is reportable, chatting makes absolutely no sense as even the slightest critique seems to be reportable. But if I cannot criticise (and be criticised), what is the chat good for then?
